STATE OF MICHIGAN

GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 12, 2024
Marci Canales
New Hope Youth Center
1719 E HIGH ST,
MT PLEASANT, MI, 48858-8989
Re: License #: CI370377212
SI #: 2024SIC0001372
Dear Ms. Canales:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has been brought to the emergency room back-to-back due
to incidents at the facility that have increased suicidal ideations.
There have been multiple safety plans with the facility that have
not been followed. A staff reported the facility is short staffed,
impacting supervision. The staff reported that they do not prevent
a youth from acting on thoughts of suicide and will not prevent
them physically from jumping into traffic.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on April 30, 2024,
and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone by this consultant and
face-to-face by MDHHS worker at the hospital on April 25,
2

2024. Youth A said she has been placed at New Hope Center for
three months. Youth A said there are usually 2 staff working during
the daytime, 3 in the afternoon and evening, and 2 overnights
while the youth are sleeping. Youth A said, “all the staff” are very
nice and she “loves them”. Youth A said since Youth E has been
placed at New Hope Center things are more chaotic and she does
not feel safe as the staff are not able to protect her and keep her
safe. Youth A said Youth E wants her to “do sexual stuff” and since
she refuses Youth E keeps trying to beat her up and will often walk
by her and hit her. Youth A said Youth E has been bullying and
beating youth up since she was placed at New Hope Center.
Youth A said Youth E tried to set the house of fire by turning on the
stovetop and putting paper towel on the burner. Youth A said she
thinks the staff are afraid of Youth E and try to stop her from her
assaultive behaviors but are not “strong enough” to keep her from
hurting other youth. Youth A said she has been bullied by Youth E
and Youth H and staff are aware but cannot do anything to stop
the behavior. Youth A said she has been in the hospital for suicidal
thoughts, self-harm, and attempts of suicide. Youth A said she has
attempted to jump into traffic on three occasions and has had to
be pulled out of the road by staff each time. Youth A said she was
not on a safety plan while at New Hope Youth Center however
was on “constant supervision”. Youth A said staff are supposed to
watch youth closely and do more “checks” on them when they are
on constant supervision. Youth A said staff are not always able to
keep close watch on youth or do the extra checks because staff
“have to deal with so many other girls and issues in the house”.
Youth A said on April 24, 2024, Youth E, Youth G, and Youth H
went AWOL from the facility and “got liquor” and came back to the
facility and caused “a bunch of trouble”. Youth A said she was on
constant supervision that day however she was unsupervised in
the bathroom cutting with a sharp piece of plastic when Youth E
came back from AWOL and Supervisor Z wrote a note and put it
under that door that Youth E was looking for her so to finish using
the bathroom and go directly downstairs. Youth E said she went
into the basement with Case Manager for her own safety however
Youth E and Youth H got into a physical altercation and therefore
Case Manager left her alone in the basement and responded to
the situation upstairs with Youth E and Youth H. Youth A said she
knows the code to the computer so logged on and was watching
the altercation on the camera. Youth A said during the physical
altercation Staff 1 had a seizure which caused Youth E and Youth
H to stop fighting. Youth A said the police and EMT arrived and
assisted staff with the youth. Youth A said there have not been
extra staff working since Youth E has been placed. Youth A denied
Youth E having any safety plan or one-on-one staffing. Youth A
3

said if a youth runs away the staff follow to “a certain point” and
then stop and go back to the house.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
29, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B said
she has been placed at New Hope Youth Center for a year and a
half. Youth B said Youth A, Youth E, Youth F and Youth G all self-
harm at the facility, most recently Youth A and Youth G cutting
themselves and having to be brought to the emergency room for
medical care. Youth B said Youth A cut in the bathroom and staff
provided medical care and brought her to the hospital later in the
night. Youth B said Youth G ran away from the facility, got and
drank alcohol, returned to the facility and went in the bathroom
and cut her arms, and the ambulance was called to take her to the
emergency room. Youth B denied ever hearing staff say they
would not stop youth if they are self-harming. Youth B said Youth
E has been placed at the facility for “a few weeks” and threatens
youth and staff, tried to burn down the house, and will assault
anyone “in her way”. Youth B said staff try to stop Youth E but they
are not able to. Youth B said Youth E is not on an increased
supervision status. Youth B said there are 3 staff in the morning, 3
in the afternoon/evening, and 2 at night. Youth B said she tries to
stay out of the way of Youth E. Youth B said a few days ago there
was a lot going on in the house and Staff 1 had a seizure which
was the second time she has had a seizure at work.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
29, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C said
she has been placed at New Hope Youth Center for about two
months. Youth C denied ever hearing staff say they would not
prevent a youth from self-harming. Youth C said things were
“good” at New Hope Youth Center until Youth E arrived and has
been causing many issues. Youth C said Youth E threatens staff
and youth, has spit on her, and beat other youth up. Youth C said
staff attempt to stop Youth E from harming other youth but there
are times when staff are not present in the room with the youth.
Youth C said there are typically 3 staff on each shift and there
have not been extra staff added since there have been more
issues in the house. Youth C said on April 24, 2024, she was in
the basement with Case Manger in her office watching the
cameras to upstairs when Youth E and Youth H got into a physical
altercation so she ran back upstairs with Case Manager. Youth C
said Staff 1 and Supervisor Z were trying to stop Youth E and
Youth H from fighting and Staff 1 “passed out” in Youth C’s arms.
Youth C said Supervisor Z was crying in the entryway, so she went
to calm her down. Youth C said she does not remember what
4

Supervisor Z was saying while crying. Youth C said the police
arrived and stopped the fight. Youth C said Youth A and Youth G
were both sent to the hospital for cutting that evening, but she was
unaware of at what point in the night or how they cut themselves.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
29, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth D said
she has been placed at New Hope Youth Center for one year.
Youth D said there are 3 staff that work on second shift, she does
not know how many staff work on first shift as she is at school,
and she does not know how many staff work on third shift as she
is sleeping. Youth D said Youth E has been at New Hope Youth
Center for a few weeks and is aggressive and violent to youth and
staff. Youth D said she just “does her own thing” and ignores all
the other youth. Youth D denied ever hearing a staff say they
would not stop a youth if they self-harmed. Youth D stated she did
not want to talk about anything further and ended the interview.
Youth E was seen face-to-face at the facility on April 29, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth E entered the room,
stated she had nothing to say regarding anything at New Hope
Youth Center, got up and left the room.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
29, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth F said
she has been placed at New Hope Youth Center for three weeks.
Youth F said there are normally 2 staff in the morning, 3 staff in the
afternoon/evening, and 2 staff overnights. Youth F said she does
not feel safe at New Hope Youth Center as there are not enough
staff working to “deal with all the girls”, youth are getting beat up
by Youth E and Youth H when staff are not around, and at times
staff are preoccupied in other rooms where youth are left alone.
Youth F said Youth E is assaultive to everyone including staff and
no one is doing anything about it. Youth F said there have not
been extra staff added to work with the youth however the staff
working will often have to call extra staff to come into work
because of the chaos in the facility. Youth F said she has never
heard staff say they would not stop a youth from self-harming;
however youth do self-harm at the facility. Youth F said currently
Youth A and Youth G are hospitalized for self-harming by cutting
themselves. Youth F said Youth G self-harmed and had to go to
the hospital, was brought back to the facility, self-harmed again,
and was brought back to the hospital by the police. Youth F said
on April 24, 2024, she was feeling unsafe and asked to talk to
Case Manager and was told no by Staff 1, so she asked to talk to
Medical Technician and was told no by Staff 1. She AWOLed from
5

the facility. Youth F said she walked around the neighborhood and
eventually returned to the facility. Youth F said when she returned
Youth A, Youth E, Youth G, and Youth H had AWOLed from the
facility however were being brought back by the police so she,
Youth C, and Youth D locked themselves in a bedroom by putting
a bed in front of the door because they did not feel safe in the
house. Youth F said they stayed in the bedroom for about one
hour before coming out and going back to the main floor of the
facility. Youth F said Youth E spit on her so she AWOLed again
and went to the hospital to call the police. Youth F denied being at
the facility when Youth E and Youth H got into a physical
altercation.
Youth G was interviewed via telephone by this consultant and
face-to-face by MDHHS worker at the hospital on April 25,
2024. Youth G said she has been placed at New Hope Youth
Center for one week. Youth G said she was on “enhanced
supervision” where the staff are supposed to check on her every
five minutes, but she does not know if they do the checks or not.
Youth G said she cut herself “the other day” and had to go to the
emergency room and get stiches. Youth G said on April 24, 2024,
Youth A cut herself and Supervisor Z got out medical supplies to
treat Youth A’s cuts which triggered her, so she ran away with
Youth E and Youth H. Youth G said she was gone from the facility
for about one hour during which time she found alcohol next to a
garbage can and drank it. Youth G said the police found her, Youth
E and Youth H so they all ran and tried to hide behind Rite Aid.
Youth G said the police found her and brought her back to the
facility. Youth G said once back at the facility Youth E and Youth H
started to physically fight with one another and Staff 1, Case
Manager, and Supervisor Z tried to stop them and “got attacked as
well”. Youth G said Youth H was punching Staff 1 and Case
Manager, causing Staff 1 to have a seizure. Youth G said there
was a broken mirror on the ground next to the entry way of the
facility and she grabbed part of the broken glass and ran outside,
into the road and began to cut her wrists. Youth G said none of the
staff followed her due to dealing with Staff 1’s seizures and Youth
H’s assaultive behavior. Youth G said Youth E followed her and the
police arrived and got her out of the road and wrapped up her arm
until the ambulance arrived and took her to the emergency room.
Youth G said she has been at the emergency room since that time
and is waiting on an inpatient hospitalization. Youth G said Youth
E “starts drama” with other youth every day and assaults youth
daily. Youth G said staff attempt to stop Youth E, but it does not
always work. Youth G said there are 3 staff working in the
evenings and sometimes extra staff get called into work if needed.
6

Youth G said she will often hear staff say they do not have enough
staff. Youth G said she was on “enhanced supervision” when she
cut herself at New Hope Youth Center and staff were not watching
her at the time. Youth G denied seeing Youth E on one-on-one
staffing.
Youth H was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April
29, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth H said
she has been placed at New Hope Youth Center for five months
and feels safe. Youth H said there are 2 or 3 staff that work in the
morning, 3 that work in the afternoon/evening, and 2 that work
overnight. Youth H said she has never heard a staff say they will
not stop a youth from self-harming. Youth H said there has been
“a lot” going on at the facility recently and a few days ago she was
in a fight with another youth which caused Staff 1 to have a
seizure. Youth H said this is the second time Staff 1 has had a
seizure, stating the first time was a few months ago when she was
standing for a long period of time and “passed out”. Youth H said if
youth go AWOL the staff call the police, police find the youth and
bring them back to the house.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 29,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said she has
been working at New Hope Youth Center since January 2, 2024,
and is scheduled on second shifts. Staff 1 said the facility has 3
staff work first shift, 3 staff work second shift, and 2 staff work third
shift. Staff 1 denied ever hearing staff say they would not step in to
stop youth from self-harming. Staff 1 said since Youth E has been
placed at New Hope Youth Center there have been many issues
on second shift almost daily. Staff 1 said she was told “corporate”
took over the placements for the facility around February which
has caused a lot of chaos in the facility. Staff 1 denied any
additional staff being added to the schedule to assist with the
increased concerns in the house. Staff 1 said she has talked to
Vice President of Program Development regarding her concerns
with Youth E and was told that “he does not care” and that there
would be another youth with similar behaviors placed so they
would not ask for Youth E to be moved. Staff 1 said on April 24,
2024, there were 3 staff scheduled to work, including her, Staff 2
and Supervisor Z. Staff 1 said they completed the normal after
school pick up of the youth and once all youth returned to the
facility things became chaotic. Staff 1 said Youth E, Youth G, and
Youth H left the facility and Case Manager followed them, and five
minutes later Youth D told her that Youth F was overwhelmed and
had left the house, so she went to follow behind Youth F. Staff 1
said she blocked Youth F from walking into the road and Youth F
7

then walked through a creek and onto another road where she lost
sight of her so Staff 1 called 911 to report her AWOL. Staff 1 said
after she lost sight of Youth F she returned to the facility. Staff 1
said once she was back Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were all
downstairs with Case Manager. Staff 1 said the police called and
had reported they found Youth F and were transporting her to the
hospital, and found Youth E, Youth G, and Youth H and were
bringing them back to the facility. Staff 1 said when Youth E, Youth
G, and Youth H returned, Youth E was pacing the room staring at
Youth H and Youth H was sitting in a chair staring back at Youth E.
Staff 1 said she noticed this behavior so she stood in front of
Youth H’s chair as a barrier between Youth E and Youth H. Staff 1
said Youth E attempted to get to Youth H and Supervisor Z
blocked Youth E. Staff 1 said Youth E got around Supervisor Z and
ran at her and pushed her onto Youth H and began to punch her in
the face. Staff 1 said Supervisor Z put Youth E in an upper torso
hold and walked her away from Staff 1 and Youth H. Staff 1 said
once she “got her bearings” back from being hit she checked
Youth H and then saw she was bleeding. Staff 1 said Youth E
began to throw things around the room and somehow injured
Supervisor Z who was cringing in pain. Staff 1 said Youth H got up
and was escalated and ran towards Youth E. Staff 1 said Case
Manager put Youth H in an upper torso and moved her towards
the staircase/entryway. Staff 1 said she attempted to talk to Youth
E, Youth E moved over to the entryway, grabbed the mirror off the
wall so Staff 1 stood in front of her with her hands up to block the
mirror. Staff 1 said Staff 2 attempted to put Youth E in a restraint,
but Youth E hit him in the face before he was able to get her in the
hold. Staff 1 said it seemed “everyone was in a big group in the
entryway” and the mirror was thrown to the side and smashed all
over the floor. Staff 1 said someone got Youth E moved to the
hallway by the medication room and Youth H over to the entryway
to the living room. Staff 1 said Youth E and Youth H were yelling
across the room at each other while Staff 2 stood in front of Youth
E and Case Manager stood in front of Youth H. Staff 1 said Youth
H started to beat Case Manager in the head with her cast, so she
stepped in to block Youth H from hitting Case Manager. Staff 1
said Supervisor Z was dealing with Youth G who came around the
corner with self-harming cuts on her arm. Staff 1 said she was in
front of Youth H who tried to get by her to get to Case Manager,
and Youth B and Youth C began to pull Staff 1 away from Youth H.
Staff 1 said she had a “non-epileptic seizure” with no warning from
being overwhelmed in the situation and tired from working so
many hours. Staff 1 said when she came out of her seizure the
police and EMT were present and examining her. Staff 1 said
many youth were around her crying. Staff 1 said she had been the
8

staff to call 911 in the middle of the incident due to concerns for
everyone’s safety and the inability for staff to regain any control in
the facility. Staff 1 said when a youth AWOL’s the staff are to follow
if the facility is still in ratio. Staff 1 said if they are not able to follow
or if they do and lose sight of the youth, they are to contact the
supervisor and then the police, followed by all documentation on
the AWOL form. Staff 1 said she does not believe any youth were
on constant supervision on April 24, 2024. Staff 1 said when youth
are placed on constant supervision they are to have “eyes on
them 24/7”. Staff 1 said staff are not assigned to specific youth but
rather all staff communicate and make sure someone is watching
the youth. Staff 1 said they are to document checks as to what the
youth is doing every thirty minutes while youth are on constant
supervision. Staff 1 said there are not additional staff added to the
schedule when youth are on constant supervision.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on May 7, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said he has been
employed at New Hope Youth Center for one month. Staff 2
denied ever hearing any staff state they will not stop a youth from
self-harming. Staff 2 said since Youth E has been at New Hope
Youth Center things have been very chaotic. Staff 2 said Youth E
has claimed to cheek her medications, attempted to climb out a
window, assaulted youth and staff, and threatens youth and staff
daily. Staff 2 said he typically works second shift with 2 other staff.
Staff 2 said no additional staff have been added to support the
second shift staff until a few days ago when a one-on-one was
added for Youth E which was helpful. Staff 2 said the evening of
April 24, 2024, was very overwhelming and chaotic. Staff 2 said
Youth E and Youth H got into a physical altercation and he
attempted to restraint Youth E and was punched several times.
Staff 2 said as Youth E and Youth H were fighting, Staff 1 called
911 for assistance, and attempted to help break up the fight and
ended up having a seizure. Staff 2 said there are times when he
feels he can keep the youth safe and there are other times when
he is not able to, noting 2 situations where he witnessed youth
having to be barricaded in a bedroom to prevent Youth E from
getting to them. Staff 2 said the staff are to follow youth when they
AWOL if ratio is able to be maintained in the facility. Staff 2 said
once line of sight of the youth is lost they are to call the police and
supervisor. Staff 2 said when youth are placed on constant
supervision the staff must provide line of sight supervision to that
youth. Staff 2 said when the youth go into the bathroom the staff
are supposed to stand outside of the bathroom and talk to them to
ensure they are not self-harming. Staff 2 said the bathroom door is
allowed to be shut as long as staff stands outside the door and the
9

youth is talking. Staff 2 said he has not been assigned to do
constant supervision for any youth since starting.
Supervisor Z was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 29, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Supervisor Z said she has been employed at New Hope Youth
Center for one year and four months. Supervisor Z said when a
youth is placed on constant supervision there is a message placed
in the group chat to notify staff and Therapist will also inform staff
once they get to the facility. Supervisor Z said as the shift
supervisor she will assign a staff to the youth that is on constant
supervision to provide line of sight supervision to that youth.
Supervisor Z said the staff is to document what the youth is doing
at thirty-minute intervals. Supervisor Z said there are many times
that the facility will be very busy or chaotic which proves
challenging to keep line of sight of youth that are on constant
supervision. Supervisor Z said she is aware of times when youth
are not in line of sight due to a lack of staffing to provide that level
of supervision. Supervisor Z said they need an additional staff to
be scheduled to provide that level of supervision to the youth that
are on constant supervision, but she has been told that
administration will not allow for the additional staffing. Supervisor
Z said since Youth E has been placed at New Hope Youth Center
there have been many more issues on second shift. Supervisor Z
said Youth E has been AWOLing with other youth, assaulting staff
and youth, verbally threatening staff and youth, and attempted to
burn the house down by starting the stovetop and placing paper
towel on the burner. Supervisor Z said Youth E’s behaviors are
almost daily and she has asked the Facility Administrator and
Assistant Facility Administrator for more supports on her shifts
however no additional staff or support has been given or added.
Supervisor Z said there are 3 staff scheduled on first shift, 3 staff
scheduled on second shift, and 2 staff scheduled on third shift.
Supervisor Z said Youth E has not been placed on a safety plan, a
one-on-one, or any other increased level of supervision.
Supervisor Z said Youth E beats up the other youth and the staff
and many times she does not feel she has the tools in order to
keep youth safe in the facility. Supervisor Z said she has never
heard any staff state they would be unwilling to stop a youth if they
are self-harming. Supervisor Z said on April 24, 2024, there were
many issues on second shift. Supervisor Z said Youth G was on
constant supervision for self-harming the day prior, however had
went AWOL, was brought back to the facility by police, self-
harmed and was brought to the hospital. Supervisor Z said she is
unaware if Youth G was searched upon her return from AWOL.
Supervisor Z said Youth E and Youth H began to physically fight
10

and Youth G went into the bathroom, Case Manager checked on
her and Youth G reported she was ok however then a few minutes
later came out of the bathroom and had cut herself and was
bleeding. Supervisor Z said during the physical altercation a mirror
had been broken and when Youth G came out of the bathroom,
she grabbed a piece of the glass from the mirror and ran outside
where the police “caught” her and put her in the ambulance and
brought her to the emergency room. Supervisor Z said Youth A
had self-harmed prior to the physical altercation between Youth E
and Youth H and was in the basement with Case Manager
receiving medical care for those cuts. Supervisor Z said Youth A’s
wounds at that time were superficial and she was not brought to
the emergency room during Supervisor Z’s shift. Supervisor Z said
during the physical altercation between Youth E and Youth H, Staff
1 had a seizure. Supervisor Z said this was the second time Staff
1 had a seizure at work, the first time being a few months ago
when she was overwhelmed and had worked many hours.
Supervisor Z said she and Youth D were tending to Staff 1 when
the police arrived and took over. Supervisor Z presented as very
overwhelmed and tearful during the interview, stating so much has
gone on at the facility that she has trouble remembering the
sequence of events for specific days as they all blend together.
Supervisor Z said if a youth AWOL’s the staff are to follow if ratio
allows and if they are not able to follow or they lose sight of youth
they are to call the police.
Medical Technician was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on April 29, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Medical Technician said she had been working at New Hope Youth
Center for one month, and prior to this was working for the same
company at Osceola Youth Center as a youth specialist. Medical
Technician said since the placement of Youth E, the facility has
had “a lot going on” and she has been very overwhelmed and had
to come in on her days off and has been working every day for
many weeks. Medical Technician said Youth E has been very
problematic since her third day at the facility. Medical Technician
said Youth E will escalate “straight to 100” and assault staff, youth,
and destroy property. Medical Technician said several staff have
quit due to the chaos in the house and feeling overwhelmed.
Medical Technician said there are 2 staff scheduled for first shift, 3
staff for second shift, and 2 for third shift. Medical Technician said
there have not been any additional staff added to the schedule
despite the almost daily issues on second shift. Medical
Technician said the staff working will send out a message in the
group chat for assistance from staff who are able to come into
work and she will respond and try to help as much as possible.
11

Medical Technician said on April 24, 2024, she saw message in
the group chat that things were “going bad” at the facility. She
volunteered to go and sit at the hospital with Youth A and Youth G.
Medical Technician said while at the hospital someone from
Community Mental Health came to evaluate Youth A to determine
if she needed inpatient hospitalization. Medical Technician said
she tried to advocate for Youth A and make a statement that she
would not get hit by a car for Youth A. Medical Technician said this
comment was made in the hallway and out of earshot of Youth A.
Medical Technician said she was just very tired and overwhelmed
from working so many days in a row but that she would never
allow a youth to be harmed on her watch. Medical Technician said
when youth AWOL the staff are to follow if they are able to stay in
ratio at the facility. Medical Technician said if they cannot follow or
lose sight of the youth they are to make all AWOL notifications,
including calling the police. Medical Technician said there have
been “a few” youth on “constant supervision” due to their
behaviors of self-harm. Medical Technician said “constant
supervision” requires staff to maintain line of sight of the youth,
however no additional staff are added to the schedule, so she is
unsure of how staff are keeping constant supervision of youth and
supervising the other youth in the house. Medical Technician said
staff are also supposed to document checks of what the youth that
are on constant supervision are doing in 15 minutes intervals
during the day and 5-minute intervals at night.
Case Manager was interviewed via telephone by me and face-

Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance due to the Facility
Administrator not ensuring compliance with the rules. The Facility
Administrator reported that despite not making the decision on the
placement of Youth E and Youth G she was aware of their history
and ongoing issues. The Facility Administrator reported being
aware of the instability in the facility after the placement of Youth
E and even more so after the placement of Youth G. The Facility
Administrator was aware that Youth A and Youth G were placed
on constant supervision. The Facility Administrator was aware of
Staff 1’s nonepileptic seizures that are stress induced. The Facility
Administrator did not place Youth E on a safety or behavior plan,
did not add additional staff to the schedule to provide for the
supervision, safety, and care of the children. She did not have any
plan in place to provide Staff 1 a break if feeling overwhelmed or
having symptoms. Due to Facility Administrator’s lack of taking
preventative measures it resulted in a chaotic environment that
was unsafe for both youth and staff and violations of internal
policies and licensing rules.
